Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey Angela, you wanna see a picture of Phillip wearing those little booties you got us?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: So cute.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hey, you guys want to see a picture of Gerald wearing galoshes? He refused to go out in the rain until I bought these. Now going out in the rain is all he wants to do.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oscar thinks that having a dog is just like having a baby.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: News flash - If you didn't carry it around for nine months, it isn't your kid.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Exactly. Unless you adopted, of course.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: That is where we disagree.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hey, are your little dudes crawling yet?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, three-month-old humans don't do that.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: My Phillip is crawling.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Angela is such a liar!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's maddening!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Exactly. That's just like crate training. All night long, all night long.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well count yourself lucky. Wait until you have two. That's two sleep schedules, two naps that don't coincide, I mean, you'll never sleep again.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No one said "you must have two"

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Like her genes are so important. The world just needs more Pam/Jim DNA. Thank you, no.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [laughing] Check this out. My brother just got a new sailboat. He has NO idea what he just got himself into. There's nothing harder than taking care of a boat...am i right?

Quote.Speaker: Angela/Pam
Quote.Text: Unbelievable!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Un-be-liev-a-ble.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: It is the end of the day, it is the end of the week. We managed to fill 40 hours somehow. That's not bad, is it?

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: That's great.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pretty good.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Well thank you. This is very helpful feedback. [Dwight raises his hand] Dwight, I am still not ready to name a VP.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [laughing] That's not what I was going to ask. Gosh, jump to conclusions. Come on, I know, you've got so much on your plate. Right now, you're like 'oh, what's more important? Dwight's question, figure out who's the VP?' Dwight, VP. Dwight, VP. Dwight, VP. Dwight, VP.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I can't be hypnotized, Dwight. I tried it, I ended up smoking more.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Can we at least eliminate those that are not in the running? Free them up to focus more completely on the menial. Like stacking or sorting, or-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Catching butterflies.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's a hobby, unless it's for food.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Theater.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Waste of time.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dragging.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's just a verb.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dragging sticks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, nice, perfect. Dragging sticks.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Alright, I'm gonna eliminate three people right now, okay? Just... you three, no.

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: Not good enough (clicks tongue)

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: English peoples' main use today is judging American talent. [British accent] You're crap. You're wonderful. [back to American] They're mean, but they're incisive.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Everyone meet in the hotel bar at 7:00. I'm not allowed to say it's mandatory, so let's just call it compulsory.

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: I'll be there at 6:00

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Ugh, we're gonna have one of those crazy nights, aren't we? Maybe we'll see the real 'Talla-nasty' we've been hearing so much about.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: 'Talla-nasty', very clever.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Thank you-

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Wait, wait, you think she invented 'Talla-nasty?' [chuckles] no, no, no, no...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Cathy? It's been great. Fun, normal. [in voiceover] I thought I was gonna be hanging out with stanley on this trip, but he's turned out to be kind of a loose cannon.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: My friend and I are new here in Tallahassee. Would you like to get a cocktail? [Jim slowly slinks down in his seat, with the 'Jim Face']. Maybe go out for a little dancing. Beautiful day, no?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay, everybody. 5:00. Workday is over. Put your pencils down. Aaannnnddd bring 'em back up, because now, the late night work jam begins!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes, the conference room is set up. I've got pens, I've got paper, I've got a whiteboard, we are good to go!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Say what?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We are good to goooo!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Say what?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We're good to goooo!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Stop it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Say-

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Stop it.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Tonight we're staying late to service the accounts of the people who went on the Florida trip.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes, of course, we could've just been doing this the whole time, but SOMEONE dropped the ball.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: ...ball droppings can be beautiful. For example, when it turns an awkward soprano into a rich, full tenor.

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: Jason Bourne would kick Bond's ass.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Jason Bourne has no support staff. His own government's out to get him.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Genghis Khan could take 'em both down 'cause he's not afraid to kill children ... What? it's true. He- He would- he would eviscerate babies and hang them from poles outside of the villages. (Jim taps Dwight on the shoulder)

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: Okay, drinking game. Count of three, take three sips.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's a stupid game. I got a great drinking game. Okay, everyone empty your pockets. Whoever has the most seeds is the king. Whoever has the least buttons is the hunchback.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: What happens if you're the hunchback?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, you get kicked.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How many buttons do you have?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: (takes out bag) 40. Always.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Can I see?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sure. (Hands bag to Cathy)

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: So, I get to kick you now.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, they're not transferrable just 'cause I handed 'em to you.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Well, that's how I played it in college.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: College rules (Cathy throws Jim the bag and Jim kicks Dwight)

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Aah!

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: Aaaaand he host at his own lame game.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Ooh, double meaning! The game was lame, and now he's lame from the kick. Quick wit.

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: (Dwight looks on angrily)

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'll have a glass of your oakiest chardonnay, please.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: And I will have waffle with your mapliest syrup.

Quote.Speaker: Waitress
Quote.Text: Sorry, no waffles.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, okay. Just forget it, then. Forget it. Forget it.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: A waffle?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: A hotel waffle. I know what I want to eat. Is that crazy?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm moving down here, you know.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh, no, I didn't know.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm young, and I can ... and if I can't, I'm still pretty young. I guess I'll always be young.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You come with me. We're gonna get you that waffle.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Why would Erin confide in me that she's staying here in Florida if she didn't want me to make some last-ditch, nothing to lose, Kelly Ka-who run at her? (Erin walks over) Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Watson carpet and tile.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: One order.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Order reference number 00983-126.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Eight Cases, bright white inkjet.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Paid.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I'm dying!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Processed.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: And delivered.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Sometimes I get so bored I just want to scream, and then sometimes I actually do scream. I just sorta feel out what the situation calls for.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I will be right back.

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: I will be here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey. I see what you're doing. It's futile. the VP position is mine.

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: Oh, please, You're through. She's going to give it to me as I'm giving it to her tonight. The cowgirl has chosen her saddle. [clicks tongue, whinnies]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, saddles... [clicks tongue, whinnies] ... sometimes fall off, especially if you don't properly cinch the girth.

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: What? That's a joke, right? You see the way she's all over me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If anyone's having sex with Nellie for personal gain, it's me, and I'm not joking at all. If you don't tighten your saddle, you may fall off.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Who is ready for dinner? "oh, I bet it's pizza, or tacos, or something stupid". No. [claps] I went south of the border for this. And then I went south of that border. And we have ourselves... [takes foil off tray] [Jamaican accent] A Jamaican feast, mon!

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Disapproval from everyone else]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: If I wanted Jamaican food I'd just hire a bunch of bodyguards and go there.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Additional trivia factoid, this food comes to us through Val. And our server is none other than Brandon, her boyf!

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Brandon
Quote.Text: How you doing, Val? [Val and Brandon kiss]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Jamaican, huh? I just read about the elections down there. Crazy stuff.

Quote.Speaker: Brandon
Quote.Text: Oh no, I'm not actually Jamaican.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Terrific.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What's up man? I'm Darryl.

Quote.Speaker: Brandon
Quote.Text: Darryl, I heard about you. You doing good?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Brandon
Quote.Text: Must be doing real good since you're f***ing my girlfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: Whoa.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Dude, you didn't tell me you were f***ing Val. High five!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'm not sleeping with your girlfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Brandon, what the hell are you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Brandon
Quote.Text: Don't play dumb with me. I know what's up.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Honey, I am not sleeping with-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Heyyy... let's get back to the food. Brandon, tell us about these delicious looking goops!

Quote.Speaker: Brandon
Quote.Text: Hope you all like goat.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Goat...

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Blow in my ear.

Quote.Speaker: Packer
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Like I'm on the beach.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Packer blows in Nellie's ear]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [imitates seagull calls] Seagull. [Continues seagull calls]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: And a wave crashing... a wave crashing.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Packer and Dwight imitate waves]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, that is lovely.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright, that's gonna do it for me tonight. Have a lovely evening.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Cathy knocks on Jim's door and Jim answers]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, how's it going?

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Hey, uh, good. Uh, the heating system though in my room is all messed up. It's like 90 degrees in there. Maintenance is working on it. Can I hang out here?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh... yeah, I'm just watching basketball.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Okay, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Cool... [Jumps onto bed] Is this March Madness? I love March Madness.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, no, that's not this 'cause that's in... March. Uh, this is just the NBA. Professional. Miami Heat, actually, so... [sits on floor]

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: LeBron James.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes, nice. Good word association

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: [giggles]

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Cathy walks over to mini fridge and bends over to take something out. Jim looks away]

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Packer takes string out of his mouth]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Impressive.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh please, anyone can tie a knot, the real skill is in untying it [puts string in his mouth]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thornwood Wholesalers.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: One order.

Quote.Speaker: Brandon
Quote.Text: I read the text you sent to Val, man.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: That's messed up.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Is this spicy?

Quote.Speaker: Brandon
Quote.Text: No, baby girl. It would be messed up if I didn't find anything, but I did, so-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm pretty sure if Darryl sent Val a text, it was about some paper emergency or something.

Quote.Speaker: Brandon
Quote.Text: At midnight?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: ... yeah...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: It happens! Like a hospital needs more napkins for surgery...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Guys, we're not gonna settle anything this way. I think we just need to be grown-ups here.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I thin we're gonna need to here those texts.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Kelly, remember how you wanted to go home before?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: No. There's no way in hell I'm leaving. Something interesting is happening here for once in my life, I am staying here. Darryl, read the texts.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Knock at the door]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yup, coming. [opens door] All right.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: My mini bar is oddly out of rum.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We have plenty.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Oh, hello. [laughs with Cathy]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Do you want to watch the game with us? We're watching a game. The Heat game. Just a game.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Got it. Good night. Careful Jim, it gets easier and easier.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, no, no, Stanley.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: mm-hmm. [about to leave]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Stanley. Stanley.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: uh-huh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Stanley. Uhh... you know what? Just bring back those bottles!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Whoa. the lights are still on.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, they keep them on 'cause it's less expensive than turning them on and off.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I like how guys just know stuff all the time.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Girls know a lot of stuff too, okay? And nobody knows more than you. Especially me.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [gasps] Hello, waffle iron.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hello, what do we have here?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Okay, so the recipe says we need a mixing bowl...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: ... a measuring cup...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Got that. [Metallic thud] Get down.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [whispers] It's the fuzz!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [whispers] Shh! do you want us to get scolded? Shut your beautiful, beautiful mouth, please.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: "I got too much ice cream. You want some?" "Getting' my fry on."

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Boring.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Uh, "The moon is huge tonight."

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Ooh, gosh, the moon one's damning. Yeah, sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That's regular text talk.

Quote.Speaker: Brandon
Quote.Text: You forgot one.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: "You're such a great friend."

Quote.Speaker: Brandon
Quote.Text: With the dots.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: "You're such a great friend, dot dot dot dot dot."

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Five dots, Darryl, are you kidding me? Okay, 'cause three dots means 'to be continued', four dots is a typo, but five dots means "Whoa, do not make me say what I want to say, baby, but if I did, it would blow your mind, dot, dot, dot, dot, dot.

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Brandon
Quote.Text: See? Yes. Thank you, sister.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Brandon, Darryl and me? That's ridiculous, right?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, totally crazy. Puts me in an insane asylum just thinking about it. I'm stranded on shutter island over here.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: You look like Ed Harris if they stretched him a little bit.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You wanna see a picture of me trapped under a tree? [cell phone rings] ...ahhmmm... excuse me... What?! Not now, I'm busy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on phone] I'm sorry, I thought you'd want to know that I saw a bedbug in my room. But, never mind, sorry to interrupt.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait wait wait wait, bedbugs? Oh no... Freak, I need a favor.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Well, then you have to call me by my name. Gabriel Susan Lewis.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I gotta be gone for a few minutes. You make sure that Packer does NOT sleep with Nellie.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: What's in it for GSL?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You really want Packer as your boss?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Got it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If Jim has bedbugs, that means they're everywhere. I can't risk them coming back to Schrute Farms. Our biggest attraction is our 200 year old mattresses.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Where did you see it?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: In the bed.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: I haven't seen anything.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We gotta find it before it eggs. [pulls sheets off bed]

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Jeez...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Describe it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Brown, shiny, painful bite.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Could be a bat weevil... Describe its mood. Did it seen sleepy?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Stressed, but to be fair, it was a tense situation.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Fair enough, but after it bit you, did it run away fearful, or did it walk away smug, self-assured?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So smug. Like he thought it was funny, like this.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pshh. That's a bedbug.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Everything's a joke.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Check your hair! [checks Jim's hair]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ow.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: God, oh. So greasy, you should just shave all this.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Just check it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You are clean. Okay... One thing a bedbug thrives on is heat and carbon dioxide [starts running in place and turning up the thermostat] I am going to generate myself into a human trap. [starts to take off clothes] When I jump into the bed, you are going to cover me with the sheet immediately. And then we'll see who's laughing. [dastardly laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah. [jumps into bed] Cover me!

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Is this really nessecary?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He knows what he's doing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let the bedbugs bite!

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Ugh, god, I feel so gross. I have to go take a shower.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright, then I will catch you later... What do we do now?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We wait. [Shower starts] Come to papa.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Packer and Nellie are speaking softly to each other. Gabe sprays his inhaler into Packer's drink.]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know, Dwight, I think maybe you should check again.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Nope, I wasn't bitten.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, maybe it isn't warm enough in here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, it's plenty warm, and I was farting continuously under the sheet, creating a kind of greenhouse effect.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If there were any in here, They would've imbedded themselves in me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what? Maybe they just ate.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, you're good. Clean bill of health! Besides I gotta get back downstairs. I left Packer alone with Nellie for way too long.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, they're fine. They're adults.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, that's the problem. Packer is trying to bed Nellie for the VP job unless I do it first.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is that really how you want to get this job?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Such a chorus girl.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, Dwight... Dwight... Dwight, Dwight Dwight!... uh...

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: [in a bathrobe] Is crazy gone?

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Jim does his signature face]

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Nellie and Packer are dancing. Gabe winks at Dwight. Packer pukes all over Gabe's slacks and walks off.]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: They don't make these cords in boot cut anymore!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Euughh... Pathetic, huh? A real man swallows his vomit when a lady is present... Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Yeah, one death by chocolate, one bananas foster... Okay, cool. Thanks... I know, I'm a pig, right?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hmm? No.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: [giggles] Wait, this why I exercise like a fiend. Feel. Seriously.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay alright. [gets up] I'm really sorry, uh, I just have to say it. I'm-I'm married. I'm very happily married.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Oh my God, what are you thinking?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: um... I mean-

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: I know that you're married, I sat at your wife's desk. How little do you think of me?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, I feel like maybe I'm-I'm I misread things. Okay, let's just go back to watching.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Can you... without running to the other side of the room all night?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes, I can. [Cathy laughs] uh, all right. I'm really sorry. I think we'll just... we'll just watch. You can watch, not watch, whatever you want to do. Take another shower, I don't care.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Okay. [Sits next to Jim.] I am so cold.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Jim Face]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Darryl. You okay?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: She's got a boyfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Play it cool, man. She'll come around.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, you should go for it. I mean nothing would've happened with me and Jim if he didn't put himself out there.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, but... My friend Jim would tell you to play it cool.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: My husband would tell you to go for it.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey, this is fun.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: A lot of fun.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I know. Can I give you a compliment? I'm really impressed by how much you've grown. Since I met you, it's like night and day.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You should move down here with me.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: We could be roommates.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: We could get a dog. We could go to R-rated movies. And who knows, I mean, you're a guy, I'm a girl-

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Maybe in six months-

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [louder] Six months?... um, okay, I'm in love with Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Put your forehead near mine, and see if you can read my thoughts.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay... Seven, one, one, nine...

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: No, no, no, not numbers, no.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Try again... Ugh, I'm still getting numbers! Seven, one, one... is anyone around here thinking the numbers seven one one? 'Cause please stop, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Dwight, give me a key card to your room. Meet me in seven minutes for some one-on-one time.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [gasps]Wait, the numbers!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: oh...

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: mm-hmm...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There you go.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I will see you in seven-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Seven minutes. [Dwight and Nellie kiss]... Nellie, wait. Let me write my room number on the card. [chuckles]. [Dwight writes on the key card scratches it with a magnet and hands it back to Nellie]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [in voiceover] Win at all costs, don't respect women. These are the tenets I was brought up with, and they have served me well. But my ancestors never worked in corporate America, and before that, hunters. And before that, time travelers. And before that, me again. At least, that's how the legend goes. The point is they never had to worry about how they got ahead. They just had to put food on the table and not alter the past.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It has been processed.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: It has been delivered.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's it, last one.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Everyone applauds]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Andy this has been an amazing night. Epic.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Cool-down fiesta begins right now. I got decaf coffee...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: No way.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I got Romy and Michele's High School Reunion...

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Hey. I just wanted to apologize. I mean, that was so weird. Can we just, like, never talk about it again?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Okay, thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey, just so you know, me and you... I don't think that's ridiculous... Dot, dot, dot... dot, dot.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Jim walks into his room to find a bathrobe on the floor]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right. Now I think it's time for you to go.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: What? Oh, Jim, I thought we talked about this. You're cool, right?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Cathy, go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [wearing face mask with spray chemicals in hand] Where's the bug?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sprays the bed and Cathy] Stand back!

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Aah! Stop, it, oh my god! That burns! what is that?!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [continues spraying the bed] It's a compound of chemicals I pulled off the maid's cart!

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: [coughs and moans]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right there! [points to Cathy]

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Oh stop it, stop it, stop it!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [coughs] Oh, big one! Big one! Really big one!

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: I can't breathe!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I think I saw it!

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: Stop it! [runs out the door]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nice job, I think you got 'em.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You can't stay here, this place is a biohazard. If I were you, I'd just bunk with Cathy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Jim face]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Second best Bananas Foster I've ever had.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh yeah? What's the first best?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [at the door, unsuccessfully trying to open it with the demagnetized key card] Dwight? [knocks] Hello? Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [whispers] Is that Nellie?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [whispers] Don't let-shh!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Are you in there? I can see the light on under your door. Hello? [knocks] [Dwight turns off the lights] Oh, look at that. The light went off, just as I said the light went on. Hello? [knocks] Dwight? [whispers] Dwight. [Dwight eats his Bananas Foster]
